block.p: BON-TON STORES INC., York, Pa., an operator of 72 department stores in New York, Pennsylvania and other Eastern states, said it would cut 187 positions, about 2 percent of its work force, to reduce costs.
SAFELITE GLASS CORP., Columbus, Ohio, an automotive glass replacement and repair company, filed a petition for protection under Chapter 11 of the Federal Bankruptcy Code in Wilmington, Del.

UNION PACIFIC RESOURCES GROUP INC., Fort Worth, an oil and natural gas exploration company being acquired by Anadarko Petroleum Corp., Houston, plans to sell its producing properties in southern Louisiana.

LIFETIME HOAN CORP., Westbury, N.Y., a maker of kitchenware and bakeware, said it increased its buyback of stock by as many as 1 million shares, or 8.8 percent of the company's shares outstanding. The repurchase is currently valued at $7.25 million.
